title: Greater Albion Releases Paveline
content:
We have just released Paveline on [Myfonts.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202211538/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/gatf/paveline/).

Paveline is a punctuated script; by which we mean it has the look and character of handwriting, but the glyphs are discrete entities to aid legibility. It is actually based on a moderately stylized adaptation of our chief designer’s handwriting. Use it to give a handwritten touch to your work. Paveline works well as small handwriting or large scale poster captions. You can see some more samples of Paveline in action on our [blog](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202211538/http:/gatf.wordpress.com/).

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202211538im_/http:/typophile.com/files/31234_5327.png)
author: Rasendyll

comments.content: We've just added details of an introductory promotion for Paveline to our [blog](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202211538/http:/gatf.wordpress.com/), as well as a promotional offer on the established Sabio family.
maybe you should check the UC D for overlapping paths.

Do you kern and proof your type before you release it? This is at least the third time I’ve seen a promotional image that suggests you don’t know how to design type or how to use Photoshop. Maybe it’s time to stop focusing on volume and start fixing all those bad overlaps and giant gaps.
